intro: Galium sylvaticum var. lugdunense, commonly known as the European bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Galium sylvaticum var. lugdunense typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
